### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration

• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
 – Electricity Group comprising:

 – Steam Engines:

  • Others at (x=-14.5, y=13.5), (x=7.5, y=35.5) and (x=8.5, y=20.5) as previously detailed.
• Fluid System Submodule:
 – Boiler Module:
  • After initial placement at (x=-16.0, y=23.5) and repositioning to (x=-14.0, y=19.5), the boiler was rotated (step 1304) and now appears at (x=-13.5, y=19.0) with new connection points at (x=-15.5, y=18.5) and (x=-11.5, y=18.5).
  • Multiple attempts to bridge the fluid connection between the boiler and the steam engine – via calculated intermediate points (e.g. candidates near (x=-15.75, y=17.5), (x=-16.5, y=19.5), (x=-16.5, y=18.5), (x=-13.5, y=20.5) and (x=-10.5, y=19.5)) – have all failed.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Crafting Dependencies:
 – Ensure all sub-ingredients are available and produced via proper methods before initiating compound crafting operations.

• Boiler Placement and Rotation Challenges:
 – When repositioning or rotating a boiler, verify that its new connection points are correctly aligned with the target’s fluid connection points.
 – Confirm that the placement area is free of terrain obstructions and other entities to avoid repeated connection failures.

• Fluid Connection & Intermediate Pipe Failures:
 – Ensure both source (boiler) and target (steam engine) connection points are unobstructed and correctly aligned.
 – When using intermediate pipe segments, recalculate candidate positions and utilize nearest buildable area methods to ensure clear placement.
 – Reposition entities or clear potential blockages along the intended pipe route to allow successful fluid linkage.

• Pipe Placement Obstruction Issues:
 – Before placing a pipe, double-check that the target location isn’t already occupied by another object.
 – If collisions occur, adjust the placement by selecting alternative nearby buildable positions to avoid blockage.

• General Placement and Resource Handling:
 – Pre-calculate material requirements and validate resource availability in advance to prevent cascading errors during assembly and connection tasks.
